ThingDef.label: Nickel
ThingDef.description: Nickel belongs to the transition metals and is hard and ductile. Nickel is a silvery-white metal with a slight golden tinge that takes a high polish.

ThingDef.label: Cobalt
ThingDef.description: Cobalt-based blue pigments have been used since ancient times for jewelry and paints, and to impart a distinctive blue tint to glass, but the color was later thought by alchemists to be due to the known metal bismuth.

ThingDef.label: Pyrolusite ore
ThingDef.description: Manganese is named for various black minerals such as pyrolusite. Manganese phosphating is used as a treatment for rust and corrosion prevention on steel.

ThingDef.label: Manganese
ThingDef.description: Manganese is named for various black minerals such as pyrolusite. Manganese phosphating is used as a treatment for rust and corrosion prevention on steel.

ThingDef.label: Wolframite ore
ThingDef.description: Wolframite was highly valued as the main source of the metal tungsten, a strong and quite dense material with a high melting temperature used for electric filaments and armor-piercing ammunition, as well as hard tungsten carbide machine tools.

ThingDef.label: Tungsten
ThingDef.description: Tungsten, also known as wolfram, a hard, rare metal. Tungsten's hardness and high density give it military applications in penetrating projectiles. Tungsten compounds are also often used as industrial catalysts.

ThingDef.label: Chromium
ThingDef.description: Manganese is named for various black minerals such as pyrolusite. Manganese phosphating is used as a treatment for rust and corrosion prevention on steel.

ThingDef.label: Silver ore
ThingDef.description: This metal is mostly used as a commodity currency. It can also be used for making attractive decorations.

ThingDef.label: Gold ore
ThingDef.description: The most seductive metal of them all. Millions have died in attempting to feed the endless human thirst for gold. This soft metal is little use on its own, but is strikingly beautiful and very rare.

ThingDef.label: Iron ore
ThingDef.description: Iron ore are rocks and minerals from which metallic iron can be economically extracted.

ThingDef.label: nickel ore
ThingDef.description: Nickel ore is a kind minerals, natural mineral formations, the nickel content of which is sufficient for a cost-effective extraction of the metal or its compounds.

ThingDef.label: Gold alloy
ThingDef.description: Gold alloy crafted from gold.

ThingDef.label: Sterling silver
ThingDef.description: Sterling silver is an alloy of silver.

ThingDef.label: Copper alloy
ThingDef.description: Copper alloy crafted from copper ore.

ThingDef.label: Aluminium alloy
ThingDef.description: Aluminium alloy crafted from bauxite.

ThingDef.label: Cast-iron
ThingDef.description: Cast iron is a group of iron-carbon alloys with a carbon content greater than 2%.

ThingDef.label: Steel
ThingDef.description: Steel is a group of iron-carbon alloys with a carbon content less than 2%.

ThingDef.label: Sendust alloy
ThingDef.description: Ferrosilicon is produced by reduction of silica or sand with coke in presence of iron. Ferrosilicon is used as a source of silicon to reduce metals from their oxides and to deoxidize steel and other ferrous alloys. This prevents the loss of carbon from the molten steel.

ThingDef.label: Spiegel alloy
ThingDef.description: Ferromanganese, a ferroalloy with high content of manganese. Adding of manganese increases the hardness of steel, its corrosion resistance and resistance to tearing.

ThingDef.label: Alpaca alloy
ThingDef.description: Copper-nickel is an alloy of copper that contains nickel and strengthening elements, such as iron or manganese. As a result of mixing copper and nickel alloy obtained has a high resistance to corrosion, and the electrical resistivity and strength increases.

ThingDef.label: Stein alloy
ThingDef.description: It's a ferronickel alloy. Iron-nickel is an alloy of iron that contains nickel and strengthening elements, such as iron or manganese.

ThingDef.label: Permalloy
ThingDef.description: Permalloy is a nickel–iron magnetic alloy, its very high magnetic permeability, which makes it useful as a magnetic core material in electrical and electronic equipment, and also in magnetic shielding to block magnetic fields.

ThingDef.label: Alnico alloy
ThingDef.description: Alnico alloys are ferromagnetic, with a high coercivity (resistance to loss of magnetism) and are used to make permanent magnets. Alnico alloys make strong permanent magnets, and can be magnetised to produce strong magnetic fields.

ThingDef.label: Cobalt-iron alloy
ThingDef.description: Cobalt alloy steel crafted from steel and cobalt. Useful for building structures, weapons, and even some prosthetics.

ThingDef.label: Nichrome alloy
ThingDef.description: Nichrome generally refers to any alloy of nickel, chromium, and often iron and/or other elements or substances. Nichrome alloys are typically used in resistance wire.

ThingDef.label: Stellite alloy
ThingDef.description: Stellite alloy is a range of cobalt-chromium alloys designed for wear resistance.

ThingDef.label: Ferrotitanium alloy
ThingDef.description: Titanium alloy crafted from ilmenite.

ThingDef.label: Pobedite alloy
ThingDef.description: Pobedite is a sintered carbide alloy of tungsten as a hard phase, and cobalt. Sintered composite alloys possess particularly high hardness. Pobedite is close in hardness to diamond.

ThingDef.label: Wood log
ThingDef.description: Wood from trees or other fibrous plants. Useful for building structures, weapons, and even simple prosthetics. A raw stick of wood can be used as a weapon in a pinch.

ThingDef.label: Cloth
ThingDef.description: Cloth woven from organic fibers.

ThingDef.label: synthread
ThingDef.description: Spacer-tech synthetic fabric designed for making ordinary clothes. It is soft, light, strong, and insulates well.

ThingDef.label: devilstrand cloth
ThingDef.description: Fabric spun from microfibers extracted from silk-producing Devilstrand mushrooms. Very tough, but insulates no better than cloth.

ThingDef.label: hyperweave
ThingDef.description: High-tech nano-fibers woven into sheets. It is somewhat heavy, but is incredibly difficult to break. The secrets of its production are known only to the most advanced glitterworld cultures.

ThingDef.label: muffalo wool
ThingDef.description: Soft, light and provides very good insulation. Wool clothes can keep the body warm even in extreme conditions.

ThingDef.label: camelhair
ThingDef.description: Camelhair clothing is usually worn by desert travelers to protect them from the heat. It provides excellent insulation due to its thermostatic properties.

ThingDef.label: alpaca wool
ThingDef.description: The remarkably soft wool of an alpaca.

ThingDef.label: rimram wool
ThingDef.description: The remarkably soft wool of an alpaca.

ThingDef.label: raw xerigium
ThingDef.description: A pack of herbal concoctions typically extracted from the xerigium plant. Less potent than industrial pharmaceuticals.

ThingDef.label: medicine
ThingDef.description: Medical staff use these supplies to heal the wounded.

ThingDef.label: Advanced medicine
ThingDef.description: Advanced medical supplies from a high-tech glitterworld.

ThingDef.label: Herbal medicine
ThingDef.description: Herbal medical staff use these supplies to heal the wounded.

ThingDef.label: Hemp
ThingDef.description: Cloth woven from the stuff those guys are smoking who decided that wearing this was a good idea?.

ThingDef.label: ram wool
ThingDef.description: The remarkably soft wool of a ram.

ThingDef.label: Glass batch
ThingDef.description: Glass batch made from sand. Used for structures and items.

ThingDef.label: Glass frame
ThingDef.description: Transparent material that is quite popular despite being fragile. Glass made from sand.

ThingDef.label: Reinforced glass frame
ThingDef.description: Stronger than normal glass but harder to work with.

ThingDef.label: raw cotton
ThingDef.description: Raw cotton. It can be spun into cloth or sold to a trader.

ThingDef.label: Raw devilstrand
ThingDef.description: Raw devilstrand. It can be spun into cloth or sold to a trader.

ThingDef.label: Wood plank
ThingDef.description: Wood planks crafted from logs. Useful for building structures, weapons, and even simple prosthetics.

ThingDef.label: Kindling
ThingDef.description: Kindling made from wood logs. Used as fuel in the steam generator.

ThingDef.label: Mulch
ThingDef.description: Mulch made from wood logs. Used for enriching the soil.

ThingDef.label: Sand
ThingDef.description: Sand made from stone chunks. For making glass and other items.

ThingDef.label: Silicon
ThingDef.description: Silicon or silicium is the one of the most common element in the universe by mass, but very rarely occurs as the pure free element in nature. It is most widely distributed in dusts, sands, planetoids, and planets.

ThingDef.label: Ethanol fuel
ThingDef.description: A can of ethanol fuel. It can be used to fuel the steam generator, or sold to a trader.

ThingDef.label: Electronic components
ThingDef.description: An electronic component is any basic discrete device or physical entity in an electronic system used to affect electrons or their associated fields. Electronic components are mostly industrial products, available in a singular form and are not to be confused with electrical elements, which are conceptual abstractions representing idealized electronic components.

ThingDef.label: Integrated circuits
ThingDef.description: An integrated circuit or monolithic integrated circuit is a set of electronic circuits on one small plate of semiconductor material, normally silicon. This can be made much smaller than a discrete circuit made from independent electronic components.

ThingDef.label: Microchip integrated circuits
ThingDef.description: Integrated circuits with a microprocessor is a computer processor that incorporates the functions of a computer's central processing unit (CPU) on a single integrated circuit, or at most a few integrated circuits.

ThingDef.label: Bioelectronic devices
ThingDef.description: Bionic microelectronic chips.

ThingDef.label: Biomatter
ThingDef.description: Biomatter extracted from a human corpse. Used to grow organs in the organ vat.

ThingDef.label: Artificial bone
ThingDef.description: A carefully crafted synthetic bone piece.

ThingDef.label: Nitre
ThingDef.description: Major uses of potassium nitrate are in fertilizers, tree stump removal, rocket propellants and fireworks. It is one of the major constituents of gunpowder.

ThingDef.label: coal ore
ThingDef.description: A lump of coal.

ThingDef.label: charcoal
ThingDef.description: A lump of charcoal.

ThingDef.label: Rubble
ThingDef.description: Rubble formed from stone blocks and chunks.

ThingDef.label: Ash
ThingDef.description: Ash obtained after burning corpses or other things.

ThingDef.label: copper ore
ThingDef.description: Copper is a chemical element. It is a ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity. Pure copper is soft and malleable. A freshly exposed surface has a reddish-orange color. It is used as a conductor of heat and electricity, a building material, and a constituent of various metal alloys.

ThingDef.label: bauxite
ThingDef.description: Aluminium is a silvery white, soft, nonmagnetic, ductile metal, remarkable for the metal's low density and for its ability to resist corrosion due to the phenomenon of passivation.

ThingDef.label: ilmenite
ThingDef.description: Titanium is a chemical element. It is a lustrous transition metal with a silver color, low density and high strength. It is highly resistant to corrosion in sea water, aqua regia and chlorine.

ThingDef.label: Depleted uranium alloy
ThingDef.description: Depleted uranium alloy is popular of its high density and strength. The Pentagon says that its safe for tankists!

ThingDef.label: carbon fibre composite
ThingDef.description: An extremely strong and light fiber-reinforced nanomaterial polymer, which contains carbon fibers.

ThingDef.label: concrete
ThingDef.description: Concrete is a composite material composed of aggregate bonded together with a fluid cement which hardens over time.

ThingDef.label: peat
ThingDef.description: Peat also called turf is an accumulation of partially decayed vegetation or organic matter that is unique to natural areas called peatlands or mires.

ThingDef.label: Biodiesel
ThingDef.description: A can of BioDiesel fuel. It can be used to fuel the BioGenerator.

ThingDef.label: snow block
ThingDef.description: Snow blocks are found naturally-placed in the Ice biome.

ThingDef.label: soft clay
ThingDef.description: A lump of soft clay.

ThingDef.label: clay bricks
ThingDef.description: A brick of hardened clay. Can be used for construction.

ThingDef.label: Gunpowder
ThingDef.description: Gunpowder, also known as black powder, is a chemical explosive—the earliest known. It is a mixture of sulfur, coal, and nitre. The sulfur and coal act as fuels, and the nitre is an oxidizer.

ThingDef.label: Napalm
ThingDef.description: Napalm is flammable liquid used in warfare. It is a mixture of a gelling agent and petroleum or a similar fuel.

ThingDef.label: CrudeOil
ThingDef.description: Crude oil.

ThingDef.label: Polymers
ThingDef.description: Polymers is needed for many things.

ThingDef.label: Plastic
ThingDef.description: Plastic is needed for many things.

ThingDef.label: Rubber
ThingDef.description: Rubber needs for many things.

ThingDef.label: Synthetic fibers
ThingDef.description: Synthetic fibers needs for many things.

ThingDef.label: Kevlar
ThingDef.description: Kevlar needs for many things.

ThingDef.label: Carbon
ThingDef.description: Carbon fiber reinforced polymer is an extremely strong and light fiber-reinforced polymer which contains carbon fibers..

ThingDef.label: Synthetic ammonia
ThingDef.description: Synthetic ammonia needs for many things.

ThingDef.label: Paraffins
ThingDef.description: Paraffins needs for many things.

ThingDef.label: Sulfur
ThingDef.description: Sulfur occurs naturally as the pure element - native sulfur and as sulfide and sulfate minerals. Elemental sulfur crystals are commonly sought after by mineral collectors for their distinct, brightly colored polyhedron shapes.

ThingDef.label: Fuel
ThingDef.description: A Fuel from Crude oil.

ThingDef.label: Inorganic matter
ThingDef.description: A Container of inorganic matter. Can be used to create specific resources.

ThingDef.label: bamboo
ThingDef.description: fast growing grass used for construction.

ThingDef.label: Bamboo plank
ThingDef.description: Bamboo planks crafted from logs. Useful for building structures, weapons, and even simple prosthetics.

ThingDef.label: drill head
ThingDef.description: a drill head.

ThingDef.label: pile of books
ThingDef.description: A random assortment of books. Most are old and discarded classics, but occasionally a good quality book can be found.

ThingDef.label: painting supplies
ThingDef.description: A large assortment of brushes and paints, perfect for any artist.

ThingDef.label: rainbow petals
ThingDef.description: A small bundle of multi-colored flower petals.

ThingDef.label: Mineral sonar module
ThingDef.description: This is a mineral sonar module. Deployed on the field with some energy packs, it can scan the surrounding area for metallic objects.

ThingDef.label: Alpha Poly
ThingDef.description: The first iteration in artificially constructed, atomically assembled dense matter. This man made, and extremely rare material, only assembled in high end matter assemblers is good for building structures in the chronospheres of stars.

ThingDef.label: Beta Poly
ThingDef.description: The second iteration in artificially constructed, atomically assembled dense matter. This man made, and extremely rare material, this material is too expensive to be mass produced, and has only been used as material for indestructable space suits, unstoppable kinetic slugs and containment for miniture black holes.

ThingDef.label: Antimatter
ThingDef.description: Antimatter in the form of anti-atoms is one of the most difficult materials to produce. Antimatter in the form of individual anti-particles, however, is commonly produced by particle accelerators and in some types of radioactive decay.

ThingDef.label: Magnetic material
ThingDef.description: An advanced strong magnetic material. Beyond the fabrication skills of anyone but an Electromagnetic physicist.

ThingDef.label: Biosynthetic material
ThingDef.description: An advanced high ductility material.
